title: Jack Finnie
text:
John William 'Jack' Finnie (1927-1994) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1940s.
Finnie was the son of the former 'hard punching' southpaw boxer and sometimes stand-over man John Joseph 'Jack' Finnie (1902-1968). Jack Finnie joined the <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a> in 1947. He was a fast winger that played 10 first grade games in 1948. 
His career was cut short in a violent game against <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> at <a href="Hurstville%20Oval">Hurstville Oval</a> on 24 July 1948 that almost turned into a riot. <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">East's</a> forward <a href="Sid%20Hobson">Sid Hobson</a>, kicked Finnie in the head and face and Finnie collapsed on the ground unconscious. The Dragons Ball Boy <a href="Warren%20Saunders">Warren Saunders</a> was so incensed after seeing the ugly incident, he threw the ball at <a href="Sid%20Hobson">Sid Hobson</a>, hitting him between the shoulder blades. Finnie did not play rugby league again after his severe injuries. 
Finnie died on 9 August 1994 at <a href="Marrickville%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Marrickville, New South Wales</a>. He is buried with his father and mother at Woronora Catholic Cemetery, <a href="Sutherland%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Sutherland, New South Wales</a>.
